meanings.definition: A unit of length equal to one hundredth of a meter.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter measured the small piece of wood using a fanums.
meanings.sent2: The scientist used a fanums to accurately measure the length of the tiny insect.
meanings.sent3: The tiny ant thought the fanums was a giant ruler just for him to play with.
meanings.sent4: In the land of the miniature creatures, a fanums was as long as a mighty tree.
meanings.sent5: The precision of the fanums measurement ensured the spacecraft's components fit perfectly together.

meanings.definition: A unit of currency in ancient Rome.
meanings.sent1: The merchant exchanged his goods for Roman fanums.
meanings.sent2: In ancient Rome, the citizens used fanums to buy goods at the market.
meanings.sent3: The Roman soldier joked that his salary in fanums could barely buy him a loaf of bread.
meanings.sent4: To the ancient Romans, the fanums represented their wealth and prosperity.
meanings.sent5: The discovery of a hidden stash of fanums revealed a forgotten part of history.

meanings.definition: A type of ancient Roman temple.
meanings.sent1: The tourists marveled at the grandeur of the ancient fanums.
meanings.sent2: Scholars studied the architecture of the fanums to understand its historical significance.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous children pretended the fanums was a secret hideout from imaginary foes.
meanings.sent4: The fanums stood tall and proud, a symbol of Roman engineering prowess.
meanings.sent5: Visiting the ancient fanums transported the visitors back in time to the Roman era.
